Few duskruin finds

2
Obsalyn
Sunday, September 3rd, 2017, 6:13:19 PM

a flimsy fireleaf runestaff The first thing that strikes you about the runestaff is the weight, which is about 2 pounds. In your best estimation, it's worth about 1,800,000 silvers. You can also tell that the fireleaf runestaff is predominantly crafted of fireleaf. It has a bonus of +27 from a normal runestaff, and the way it vibrates in tune with your voice tells you that it requires skill in twohanded weapons to use effectively. It also has some type of special ability, but you can't tell what yet.
The harmonics generated tell you that the runestaff allows a caster to occasionally focus their magical prowess for a single cast, temporarily granting +15 bolt Attack Strength or +9 Casting Strength. The runestaff resonates with your voice, indicating that it enhances its owner in the following ways: It provides a bonus of 5 to Spiritual Lore - Blessings Bonus. This enhancement may not be used by adventurers who have not trained 15 times. It provides a bonus of 4 to Magic Item Use Bonus. This enhancement may not be used by adventurers who have not trained 8 times. The runestaff looks to have several charges remaining. You sense that the fireleaf runestaff will persist after its last enhancive charge has been expended. MB:1 mil

A vultite handaxe The first thing that strikes you about the handaxe is the weight, which is about 3 pounds. In your best estimation, it's worth about 1,100,000 silvers. You can also tell that the vultite handaxe is predominantly crafted of vultite. It has a bonus of +20 from a normal handaxe, and the way it vibrates in tune with your voice tells you that it requires skill in edged weapons to use effectively. It also has some type of special ability, but you can't tell what yet The harmonics generated tell you that the handaxe temporarily inflicts more fearsome wounds when it strikes, has been infused with the power of a lightning bolt and has been sanctified for use by a Cleric or Paladin in the fight against the undead. The handaxe resonates with your voice, revealing some details of its temporary enhancement: The handaxe's enhancement will degrade when it scores a successful strike. It should be able to withstand quite a few uses before its enhancement has completely degraded away. When its enhancement has degraded away, the item will lose its ability to inflict greater damage. Checking out the handaxe, it looks like it is temporarily fairly weighted to inflict more critical blows than a normal weapon of its type." MB 500k

A veil iron handaxe The first thing that strikes you about the handaxe is the weight, which is about 3 pounds. In your best estimation, it's worth about 250,000 silvers. You can also tell that the veil iron handaxe is predominantly crafted of veil iron. It has a bonus of +25 from a normal handaxe, and the way it vibrates in tune with your voice tells you that it requires skill in edged weapons to use effectively. It also has some type of special ability, but you can't tell what yet.
The harmonics generated tell you that the handaxe has been infused with a flaming substance. MB 200k

A mossbark runestaff The first thing that strikes you about the runestaff is the weight, which is about 2 pounds. In your best estimation, it's worth about 300,000 silvers. You can also tell that the mossbark runestaff is predominantly crafted of mossbark. It has a bonus of +15 from a normal runestaff, and the way it vibrates in tune with your voice tells you that it requires skill in twohanded weapons to use effectively. It also has some type of special ability, but you can't tell what yet The harmonics generated tell you that the runestaff has been infused with a dark substance. The runestaff resonates with your voice, indicating that it enhances its owner in the following ways: It provides a bonus of 7 to Dexterity. This enhancement may not be used by adventurers who have not trained 17 times. The runestaff looks to have a lot of charges remaining. You sense that the mossbark runestaff will persist after its last enhancive charge has been expended. MB 100k

An etched golvern aegis The first thing that strikes you about the aegis is the weight, which is about 10 pounds. In your best estimation, it's worth about 78,000 silvers. You can also tell that the golvern aegis is predominantly crafted of golvern. It has a bonus of +25 from a normal aegis, and the way it vibrates in tune with your voice tells you that it serves some type of defensive purpose, different from that of normal armor. Large shield MB 50k

Some old double leather The first thing that strikes you about the leather is the weight, which is about 16 pounds. In your best estimation, it's worth about 150,000 silvers. You can also tell that the double leather is predominantly crafted of leather. The harmonics generated tell you that the leather temporarily serves to reduce the severity of inflicted wounds. The leather resonates with your voice, indicating that it enhances its owner in the following ways: It provides a bonus of 4 to Spell Aiming Bonus. This enhancement may not be used by adventurers who have not trained 6 times. It provides a bonus of 2 to Dexterity Bonus. This enhancement may not be used by adventurers who have not trained 7 times. The leather looks to have several charges remaining. The leather resonates with your voice, revealing some details of its temporary enhancement: The leather's enhancement will degrade when the wearer is struck in combat. It should be able to withstand quite a few uses before its enhancement has completely degraded away. When its enhancement has degraded away, the item will lose its ability to grant greater protection. You sense that the double leather will persist after its last enhancive charge has been expended. zero enchants, but temp heavy crit padded with nice enhancives MB 100k

A rolaren bastard sword The first thing that strikes you about the sword is the weight, which is about 9 pounds. In your best estimation, it's worth about 300,000 silvers. You can also tell that the rolaren bastard sword is predominantly crafted of rolaren. It has a bonus of +25 from a normal sword, and the way it vibrates in tune with your voice tells you that it requires skill in edged weapons to use effectively. It also has some type of special ability, but you can't tell what yet. The harmonics generated tell you that the sword has been infused with the power of a fire elemental. MB 150k

A gleaming rolaren war hammer The first thing that strikes you about the hammer is the weight, which is about 7 pounds. In your best estimation, it's worth about 89,000 silvers. You can also tell that the rolaren war hammer is predominantly crafted of rolaren. It has a bonus of +25 from a normal hammer, and the way it vibrates in tune with your voice tells you that it requires skill in blunt weapons to use effectively. MB 50k
